TD3489-d-07-25-89-RFP.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATELY 6:35 AM, TUESDAY, JULY 25, 1989, TRAIN R404, ENGINES RFP 122-CSX 2074-CSX 4385, 16LOADS AND 24 EMPTIES (2 HAZMATS), 2193 TONS, DERAILED THREE (3) CARS AT SOUTH MILFORD. THE CARS DERAILED WERE: CSXT 49417-EMPTY COVERED GON, CR 715564-EMPTY FLAT, CR 716193-EMPTY FLAT,. INVESTIGATIONINDICATES THE POINT OF DERAILMENT TO BE APPROXIMATELY MP 33.8 ON NO.2 MAIN TRACK. IT APPEARS THAT CSXT 497417 WAS THE FIRST CAR TO DERAIL. THE TRAIN CONTINUED NORTHWARD TO THE INTERCLOCKING AT SOUTH MILFORD WHERE THE OTHER CARS DERAILED. INVESTIGATION AS TO THE CAUSE REVEALED THE TRAILING TRUCK OF CAR CSXT 497417 WAS HUNTING, ITS LATERAL OR SWIVELING ACTION WAS IMPROPER, CAUSING IT TO CLIMB THE RAIL AND DERAIL. BOTH MAIN TRACKS WERE BLOCKED. NO.3 MAIN TRACK RESTORED TO SERVICE AT APPROXIMATELY 9:35 AM. THERE WAS EXTENSIVE DAMAGE TO THE INTERLOCKING AT SOUTH MILFORD AND SOME DAMAGES TO NO.2 MAIN TRACK. THE HOTBOX DETECTOR AT PLEASANT HILL WAS ALSO DAMAGED BY DERAILED CAR, BUT IT WAS REPAIREDAND RETURNED TO SERVICE THE SAME DAY. NO.2 MAIN WAS RESTORED TO SERVICE (WITH SLOW ORDER) AT APPROXIMATELY 6:00 PM. THE INTERLOCKING WAS PUT BACK IN SERVICE ON WEDNESDAY, JULY 26. 1989.NoneNoneNone

895-d-07-14-89-DMIR.Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
895-d-07-14-89-DMIR.Narrative: THE 4:00PM PROCTOR TO MINORCA EXTRA ON THIS DATE LOADED OUT 176 CARS OF PELLETS AND NEEDED TO RE-WATER THEIR TRAIN. THIS REQUIRED THE CREW TO SHOVE BACK APPROXIMATELY 20 CARS THRU THE LOAD POCKET. DURING THIS SHOVEBACK MOVEMENT THE LAST CAR A PARTIAL LOAD (DMIR 52562) DERAILED ACCOUNT OF THE PELLETSPILLAGE IN THE POCKET (UN-NOTICED BY THE BRAKEMAN). THE CREW THEN PULLED AHEAD RE-WATERING THEIR TRAIN AND THEN PROCEEDED TO MINORCA JUNCTION WITH THIS DERAILED CAR, EVENTUALLY BRAKING THE TRAINLINEAND PUTTING THE RAIN IN EMERGENCY. AN INVESTIGATION OF THIS INCIDENT WAS CONDUCTED ON JULY 27, 1989,AND THE REAR BRAKEMAN WAS FOUND TO BE IN VIOLATION OF RULE 808 (B) OF THE CONSOLIDATED CODE OF OPERATING RULES WHICH REQUIRES A TRAINMEN TO PROTECT THE SHOVEBACK MOVE. FOR THIS HE WAS SUSPENDED 14 WORKING DAYS.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

1-d-07-24-89-DSRC.Primary Accident Cause: Wide gage (due to defective or missing crossties)
1-d-07-24-89-DSRC.Accident Cause: Wide gage (due to defective or missing crossties)
1-d-07-24-89-DSRC.Narrative: THE TRAIN, CONSISTING OF TWO LOCOMOTIVES AND SIXTEEN LOADED COVERED HOPPERS CONTAINING WHEAT, WAS DESCENDING A .70 GRADE EASTBOUND WHEN THE FOURTEENTH CAR DERAILED BECAUSE OF THE FAILURE OF THE CROSSTIES TO HOLD GAUGE. THE TRACK IN THIS AREA IS IN A 1 DEGREE, 30 MINUTE CURVE WITH 1&1/2" ELEVATION. IT APPEARS THAT THE INSIDE RAIL SPREAD ALLOWING THE LEAD AXLE OF THE FOURTEENTH CAR TO DROP BETWEEN THE RAIL. THE LEAD TRUCK BEGAN SPREADING THE RAILS ALLOWING THE FOLLOWING CARS TO DERAIL. THE LEAD TRUCK ON THE FIFTEENTH CAR BEGAN TO PLOW TIES UNTIL IT TOTALLY DERAIL AND TURNED OVER ON ITS SIDE. WHEN THIS HAPPENED, IT PULLED THE FOURTEENTH AND SIXTEENTH CARS OVER ONTO THEIR SIDE. THEY ROLLED OVERONCE COMING TO REST ON THEIR NORTH SIDES. WHEN THE CARS ROLLED OVER, THE PULL ON THE REAR OF THE THIRTEENTH CAR LIFTED THE LEAD AXLE OFF THE RAIL AND DROPPED IT ON THE GROUND. BECAUSE OF THE SLOW SPEED (7MPH) THE TRAIN CAME TO A HALT WITHIN ONE CARLENGTH. THE TIES IN THIS CURVE SHOWED DAMAGE FROM APREVIOUS DERAILMENT AND THE DEFECTIVE TIES WERE MARKED FOR REPLACEMENT. THIS WORK COMMENCE THE SAMEWEEK THAT THE DERAILMENT OCCURRED. IT WUD APPEAR THEY WERE OVERLOADED & IMPROPERLY LOADEDNoneNoneNone
